title: No change in LAUGFS domestic gas prices in July
byline: LAUGFS Holdings Limited announced today that there will be no revision to the prices of their domestic gas cylinder refills for the month of July.

title: Seat belt rule for bus drivers enforced from today: NTC
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) announced that it will be mandatory for bus drivers to wear seat belts starting from today (July 1), NTC Director General Nayomi Jayawardana said.

title: Sri Lanka to resume seasonal employment opportunities in South Korea under E-8 visa
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) is taking steps to activate job opportunities for seasonal employment in South Korea under the E-8 visa category, Chairman Kosala Wickramasinghe said.

title: Bus fare reduction suspended following fuel price hike
byline: In the wake of the fuel price increase, the scheduled 2.5% reduction in bus fares, which was to take effect today, has been suspended, the National Transport Commission (NTC) said.

title: Youth killed, another injured in Kahawatta shooting
byline: A 22-year-old youth was shot dead and another critically injured in a shooting incident in the Yainna area of Kahawatta, police said today.

title: Royal train to be cut in Palace cost-saving measure
byline: The royal train is going to be taken out of service by 2027, in a cost-saving measure announced by Buckingham Palace.

title: Health Ministry yet to act on dog population control, veterinarian warns
byline: Despite six months having passed, the Health Ministry has failed to take proper action to control the growing dog population in the country, a leading veterinary expert claimed today.

title: Indian Defence Ministry Company set to anchor strategic influence in Colombo Port
byline: India is poised to secure another strategic investment in Sri Lanka with plans by its public sector company under the Indian Defence Ministry, ’Mazagaon Dock Shipbuilders (MDL)’ for acquiring a majority stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC (CDPLC).

title: SME paddy millers, co-ops to get loans at 7% under Yala season credit scheme
byline: The government would roll out a Rs.6.5 billion concessional loan scheme from today to support the small and medium-scale (SME) paddy millers and cooperative societies in purchasing paddy during the upcoming Yala season, the Development Finance Department said.

title: Colombo consumer prices fall 0.6% in June
byline: Inflation in the Colombo district reached a tad closer to ending the months-long deflation, as the prices fell by 0.6 percent in June 2025 from a year ago, compared to a 0.7 percent decline in the prices in May.

title: No change in domestic Litro gas prices
byline: Litro Gas Lanka Ltd today announced that there will be no revision in the price of domestic gas for the month of July.

title: No bus fare hike despite fuel price increase: Minister
byline: Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake assured the public today that bus fares will not be increased despite the recent fuel price hike.

title: Former SriLankan Airlines Chairman remanded till July 15
byline: Former SriLankan Airlines Chairman Nishantha Wickramasinghe who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) was remanded till July 15 by Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali Jayathunga.

title: Fix seat belts or leave the industry: Minister warns bus owners
byline: Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake has urged bus owners to ensure seat belts are installed and used while transporting passengers for maximum safety and advised those unwilling to comply with the law to seek employment in another industry.

title: SC rejects plea for Buddhist control of Bodh Gaya temple
byline: The Supreme Court on Monday declined to entertain a petition challenging the Bodh Gaya Temple Act, 1949, and seeking exclusive control and management of the Mahabodhi Temple in Bodh Gaya by the Buddhist community.

title: Fuel prices increased
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices, which will come into effect from midnight today (30).

title: At least 36 killed after explosion and fire at Indian factory
byline: At least 36 people have been confirmed dead after a powerful explosion triggered a fire at a pharmaceutical factory in the southern Indian state of Telangana.

title: Japan grants USD 2.5 mn to Sri Lanka to strengthen anti-corruption mechanisms
byline: The Government of Japan has granted USD 2.5 million to Sri Lanka to strengthen anti-corruption mechanisms under a 3-year project for Promoting Prosecution of Corrupt Practices through the Establishment of Anti-corruption Mechanism.

title: Harsha Ilukpitiya pleads guilty to contempt of court charges
byline: Former Controller General of Immigration and Emigration Harsha Ilukpitiya pleaded guilty before the Supreme Court over the contempt of court charges filed against him over the controversial visa deal.

title: Former Commissioner General of Motor Traffic arrested
byline: Former Commissioner General of Motor Traffic, Nishantha Weerasinghe and two others were arrested today by the Bribery Commission.

title: Musk vows to unseat lawmakers who support Trump’s ‘big beautiful bill’
byline: Elon Musk has vowed to unseat lawmakers who support Donald Trump’s sweeping budget bill, which he has criticized because it would increase the country’s deficit by $3.3tn.

title: Singapore police can now seize bank accounts to stop scams
byline: Police in Singapore can now seize control of a person’s bank account and block money transfers if they suspect the person is being scammed, under a new law that kicked in on Tuesday.

title: At least 90% of social media complaints in Sri Lanka involve Facebook, AI issues
byline: Sri Lankan authorities are raising concerns as most complaints are related to Facebook, WhatsApp, Snapchat, Instagram and TikTok with 90% of them involving Facebook and issues connected to AI.

title: Specialist neurosurgeon Dr. Maheshi’s daughter files motion seeking bail
byline: The daughter of Dr. Maheshi Surasinghe Wijerathna, a specialist neurosurgeon attached to the Sri Jayawardenapura General Hospital, has filed a bail application on her mother’s behalf.

title: Thailand’s prime minister suspended over leaked phone call with former strongman
byline: Thailand’s embattled prime minister was suspended from duty Tuesday and could face dismissal pending an ethics probe over a leaked phone call she had with Cambodia’s powerful former leader.

title: No increase in three-wheeler fares
byline: Despite the recent increase of Rs. 12 in petrol prices last night, the All-Island Three-Wheeler Drivers’ Association (AITDA) announced that three-wheeler fares will remain unchanged.

title: Indian companies explore investment opportunities in Sri Lanka
byline: Indian entrepreneurs state that they are currently directing their attention towards new investment prospects in Sri Lanka, particularly in sectors like energy, infrastructure, the digital economy, tourism and agriculture, as well as on enhancing entrepreneurial capacity.

title: Commissioner Sarangika’s conduct at Seethawaka PS challenged before Court of Appeal
byline: A writ petition has been filed before the Court of Appeal seeking an interim order to prevent the respondents, including Western Province Local Government Commissioner Sarangika Jayasundara, from conducting a secret vote for the election of the Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: Authority of LG Commissioners cannot be challenged: EC
byline: The authority of Local Government Commissioners in appointing chairpersons and deputy chairpersons to local bodies cannot be challenged under the existing legal framework, Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Ratnayake said.

title: Man, 92, jailed for 1967 murder and rape
byline: A 92-year-old man has been jailed for life with a minimum of 20 years after being convicted of the rape and murder of a woman in Bristol 58 years ago.

title: CID complaint over false claims involving Mahinda Rajapaksa and Malwathu Viharaya
byline: A group of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) activists have lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigations Department (CID) over recent social media claims involving former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and the Malwathu Maha Viharaya in Kandy.

title: Green light for online traffic fine payment system
byline: Cabinet approval was granted today to implement the government’s online traffic fine payment programme islandwide, expanding on the pilot project currently in operation, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake said.

title: 0.55 % bus fare revision to take effect from July 4
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that the annual bus fare revision will come into effect from July 4.

title: Former Commissioner General of Motor Traffic remanded
byline: Former Commissioner General of Motor Traffic, Nishantha Weerasinghe and two others were ordered to be remanded till July 8 today by Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali Jayathunga.

title: Italy to issue half million non-EU work visas over next three years
byline: Italy will issue nearly 500,000 new work visas for non-EU nationals from 2026 to 2028, a cabinet statement said on Monday, as part of a strategy to expand legal immigration channels in response to labour shortages.

title: Wimal summoned by Bribery Commission
byline: National Freedom Front (NFF) Leader and former minister Wimal Weerawansa says he has been summoned by the Bribery Commission to record a statement in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: Contract clearance needed for self-employed workers in 13 countries: SLBFE
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) announced that, effective today, Sri Lankan workers travelling to 13 designated countries for industrial and corporate sector jobs through self-employment must have their employment contracts certified by the Sri Lankan Mission in the respective country.

title: Vavuniya home destroyed after petrol used to light oil lamp
byline: A devastating fire broke out at a residence in Vavuniya after petrol was mistakenly used to light an oil lamp in the household shrine room, authorities said.

title: Import of rice to manufacture liquor now permitted - Minister
byline: Minister of Agriculture, Land, Irrigation and Livestock Development K. D. Lal Kantha said the import of rice for liquor manufacture would be allowed and facilities for it provided.

title: IMF approves 4th review of Sri Lanka’s EFF programme
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved the Fourth Review of Sri Lanka’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement.

title: Corrine Almeida obtains injunction against Romaine Willis and DJ Mass on song ’’Eh Yaye’’
byline: The Colombo Commercial High Court has issued an interim injunction, restraining popular artistes Romaine Willis and Mass Ramli Miskin alias DJ Mass from performing, reproducing and distributing the song titled ’’Eh Yaye’’ and “Api Natamu’’.

title: CSE begins July with slight pullback but investor activity remains strong
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) commenced the month of July with a slight decline in both All Share Price Index (ASPI) and S&P SL20 and , following a period of sustained gains. Despite the market’s modest pullback, investor activity remained strong, reflecting continued confidence and interest.

title: Red notices issued for over 500 premises in mosquito control raid
byline: Red notices have been issued on 553 premises following inspections carried out today (July 1) under the ongoing National Mosquito Control Week, the Ministry of Health said.

title: LG Commissioners entitled to exercise powers in the council: EC
byline: The Local Government Commissioners are entitled to exercise his or her powers in the council, Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Ratnayake said.

title: At least 36 killed after explosion and fire at Indian factory
byline: At least 36 people have been confirmed dead after a powerful explosion triggered a fire at a pharmaceutical factory in the southern Indian state of Telangana.

title: Thailand’s prime minister suspended over leaked phone call with former strongman
byline: Thailand’s embattled prime minister was suspended from duty Tuesday and could face dismissal pending an ethics probe over a leaked phone call she had with Cambodia’s powerful former leader.
